sen.j: 稲葉 正弘（いなば まさひろ、延享4年（1747年） - 安永2年9月12日 (旧暦)（1773年10月27日））は、山城国淀藩の第6代藩主。
sen.e: Masahiro INABA (1747-Octiber 27, 1773) was the sixth lord of the Yodo domain of the Province of Yamashiro.
Masahiro INABA (1747 - October 27, 1773) was the sixth lord of the Yodo Dmain of Yamashiro Province.
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。Octoberスペル訂正しました。Yodo Dmain of Yamashiro Provinceに訂正しました。
sen.e: Masahiro INABA (1747 - October 27, 1773) was the sixth lord of the Yodo Dmain of Yamashiro Province.
The tenth grand master of the Inaba family with ties to Masanari.
The tenth grand master of the Inaba family with ties to Masanari.
The tenth grand master of the Inaba family with ties to Masanari.

sen.j: 第5代藩主・稲葉正益の長男。
sen.e: The first son of Masayoshi INABA, the fifth lord of the domain.
The first son of Masayoshi INABA, the fifth lord of the domain.
The first son of Masayoshi INABA, the fifth lord of the domain.
His mother was the daughter of Yoshimura DATE.
His mother was the daughter of Yoshimura DATE.
His mother was the daughter of Yoshimura DATE.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Katasada MATSUDAIRA.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Katasada MATSUDAIRA.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Katasada MATSUDAIRA.
He had a daughter (the legal wife of Shigezumi ARIMA).
He had a daughter (the legal wife of Shigezumi ARIMA).
He had a daughter (the legal wife of Shigezumi ARIMA).

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、美濃国守、佐渡国守。
sen.e: His official court ranks were Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Mino no kuni no kami (Governor of Mino Province) and Sado no kuni no kami (Governor of Sado Province).
His official court ranks were Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Mino no kuni no kami (Governor of Mino Province) and Sado no kuni no kami (Governor of Sado Province).
His official court ranks were Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Mino no kuni no kami (Governor of Mino Province) and Sado no kuni no kami (Governor of Sado Province).
His common name was Uemon.
His common name was Uemon.
His common name was Uemon.

sen.j: 明和8年（1771年）、父の死去により後を継ぐ。
sen.e: In 1771, he succeeded his father following his death.
In 1771, he succeeded his father following his death.
In 1771, he succeeded his father following his death.

sen.j: 安永2年（1773年）9月12日、嗣子無くして27歳の若さで死去し、後を弟で養嗣子の稲葉正のぶが継いだ。
sen.e: On September 12, 1773 (old lunar calendar), he died young at the age of 27 without an heir, and Masanobu INABA, his brother and the adopted heir, succeeded Masahiro.
On October 27, 1773, he died young at the age of 27 without an heir, and Masanobu INABA, his brother and the adopted heir, succeeded Masahiro.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。 (old lunar calendar)削除しました。
sen.e: On October 27, 1773, he died young at the age of 27 without an heir, and Masanobu INABA, his brother and the adopted heir, succeeded Masahiro.
The posthumous Buddhist name: Junshoin.
The posthumous Buddhist name: Junshoin.
The posthumous Buddhist name: Junshoin.
